text: Deliverance is the debut studio album by Canadian hip hop group Citizen Kane, released in September 1999, by independent label Treehouse Records."Citizen Kane: Deliverance". Exclaim!, November 1, 1999. It was nominated for Best Rap Recording at the 2000 Juno Awards."Alanis a Juno Junkie: Morissette leads pack but Prozzak, Bachman aren't that far behind". The Province, February 3, 2000. The 2001 documentary Raisin' Kane: A Rapumentary details the promotion and release of the album."Citizen Kane film salutes native rap". Hamilton Spectator, March 1, 2001. ==Reception== Del F. Cowie of Exclaim! praised Deliverance as a "well-executed project" that "trims the fat and maintains [the group's] previous high level of quality control." ==Track listing== Samples *"Soldier Story" contains a sample of "The Changing World" by George Benson ==References== Category:1999 debut albums Category:Citizen Kane (band) albums
title: Deliverance (Citizen Kane album)
